website_summaries.verdict: A sharp, lightweight serrated knife that is a joy to use.
pros: The thin steel blade arrives sharp and holds its edge well over time
The small size makes this knife lightweight and easy to handle – it's a great knife to use when control is a priority
cons: The plastic handle can be difficult to hold onto, especially when wet

customer_reviews.title: Handle needs work
customer_reviews.text: PROS: Very sharp out of the box, thin bladed knife. Lightweight. The tip/blade geometry is excellent (easy to peel and make fine slices, cuts). CONS: Handle is thin, hard plastic. The handle is hard to grip especially with wet hands. The four inch blade is just a little too long for my taste...you might like it. OVERALL: Good paring knife for the price. Like the blade geometry better than my Wusthof paring knives and much, much cheaper though the handle needs improvement,
customer_reviews.author: blip

customer_reviews.title: Love My Second Victorinox Knife
customer_reviews.text: I mistakenly must have thrown out by long-loved Henckles paring knife. Did not want to pay over $50 again, so ordered this and I am delighted. I realized how dull my other knife was even with my regular sharpening. Has a nice feel to the handle, not slippery; it is lightweight in your hand, and I do love it, my go-to knife for kitchen use. I had previously purchased a large butcher's knife by Victorinox and the sharpness has held up well. I would not hesitate to buy more of these.
customer_reviews.author: YankeeinSC

customer_reviews.title: it's a great option.
customer_reviews.text: It has a quality serrated blade that still looks new after 9 months of light daily use. The handle is made of thin and rather slippery plastic, and while the description claims it to be "Fibrox Inspired", as an owner of a Victorinox knife with a Fibrox handle, I can safely say that they're taking some creative liberties with that one. If ergonomics are right up there in importance with blade quality, this isn't the knife for you, but if all you're looking for is a quality blade at a budget price, it's a great option.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Excellent Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what to say other than "WOW". The weight, sharpness, and balance are almost miraculous. I donated an entire knife block set to Goodwill after getting this (and other Victorinox sizes). You get used to using inferior knives over the years and don't even think about it. But try one of these and realize THIS is what an EXCELLENT knife SHOULD do! If you do a lot of food prep work like I do, you HAVE to try Victorinox. One word of warning: these are incredibly sharp and will slice right through a fingernail; luckily, it was a longer fingernail which resulted in a manicure rather than stitches. I bought a "slicer holder" right away.
customer_reviews.author: Kim D.

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp
customer_reviews.text: I bought the first knife 6 months ago, and liked it so much that I bought another one. At first glance I though it looked cheap, with its lightweight blade and plastic handle. But once I used it I was sold. I j used it to bone the better part of a pork shoulder roast because my big go-to knife couldn't handle it. Why just tonight it sliced right through my thumb with hardly any resistance at all. The only thing it doesn't do as well is slice through tomato or pepper skin, because the blade is smooth, not serrated, so it can't grip the skin. But once I get it started, it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Kilbourne

customer_reviews.title: Fake Victorinox and cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: I have never seen which is supposed to be the blunt side of the knife this sharp and hurting my finger. It’s a fake VICTORINOX knife with cheap plastic. Not even worth $2. The grip is not ergonomic and I often had to place my index finger on top of the blunt side of the knife for more grip, which cut my finger almost 2-3 times. At first I didn’t even realize what was hurting my finger until lately I saw that the blunt side is too sharp to place my finger. Very disappointing and I don’t recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: rajitha

customer_reviews.title: Incredible value, supremely sharp
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the BEST knife you can buy at it's price point. It might change in the future, but as of now these knives are about $8, and it's completely unbeatable. They're thin and sharp so they slide through anything you're doing, and even as a novice at sharpening I'm able to spend a few minutes with each knife to bring the blade back up to shaving hair off the arm sharpness. At this price you should add one to your kitchen arsenal just to see if you like the Victorinox knives, and I'm almost certain you will. These knives are made in Switzerland, a really terrific value.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Great Paring Knife Reasonable Price
customer_reviews.text: The Victorinox 4-Inch Swiss Classic Paring Knife took second place in the America's Test Kitchen review of paring knives, coming in behind a $30+ German knife. The Victorinox knife came in under $10! Delightful to hold, the blade is straight which allows for great maneuverability. Light weight, fits the hand wonderfully - a great little knife for all those cooking chores requiring a flexible, well-designed paring knife. Thank you America's Test Kitchen! Thank you Victorinox!
customer_reviews.author: James Stefanie

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic cheap knife
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a good kitchen person. I'm not a foodie or an amateur chef. But I do like to cut apples, or peel kiwi, or cut up potatoes. My wife and kids do similar and more fancy things. For our meager needs, these knives in the 4-inch size have been a nice combination of paring knife and use with dinner knife. They are inexpensive but hold up better than more expensive knives, and we really like the feel of them.
customer_reviews.author: Jason W. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: I like it (update)
customer_reviews.text: I work for Campbells Soup and this knife is extremely sharp. It cuts through cardboard extremely smoothly. I like the knife My experience buying a second knife Unfortunately, I liked these knives a lot and amazon’s tracking is off. A woman claimed she saw the package around 10 AM (9/14/2020) and amazon’s tracking claims it was delivered 1 AM... Anyways, very discouraging that people steal If anything take this as a reminder where you live before ordering anything.
customer_reviews.author: hypercrush69

customer_reviews.title: My sharpest knife
customer_reviews.text: I bought this knife to replace another knife that I broke in the kitchen. I have to say it has now became my go-to favorite knife. I use it to cut all sort of fruits and veggies. It never disappointed as it is very sharp and it is very easy enough to cut through everything. I am actually looking through for a bigger and longer one so I can use it to cut meat and other items from the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Kiki

customer_reviews.title: Great knife!
customer_reviews.text: So glad we got this! It feels very good in our hand when we're using it. Great point and very sharp. Had a pretty good workout getting ready for the July 4th weekend. Had several vegetable salads, fruit salads and meat prep. to do and this knife handled everything just great! My husband who is very critical of most knives really enjoyed using it too! "Great little knife! he said, "How much did it cost?" Would recommend without hesitation!
customer_reviews.author: Purvis Group

customer_reviews.title: Handy but slippery
customer_reviews.text: I'm a fan of the Victorinox products, and this blade has been one of my favorites. Due to sharpness and size, it is extremely useful in the kitchen. My one disappoint in this model is that they have changed from the rosewood handle to a plastic one. The plastic gives it somewhat more durability, but increases the "slipperiness" of handling - I prefer the rosewood for gripping purposes. This one issue keeps the overall at a 4 and the maneuverability to a 3. But I will probably still purchase again when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Tinker

customer_reviews.title: this is hard to beat for a pairing knife...
customer_reviews.text: arguably one of the best pairing knives i've ever bought and used with any length of time. it was sharp, stays sharp, and holds an edge when sharpened. the balance is great. i've owned knives that ranged from $300 for hand forged customs to stuff off the shelf at a dime store, and this is the very best value knife i've ever used with any length of time. buy without hesitation. i bought the 8" and 10" chef's knives at the same time and they've been fantastic thus far. they came highly recommended, so i'd pass that sentiment onto others as well.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Victorinox makes an amazing knife - again
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly SHARP! Wow, this knife cuts with precision. Swiss made precision in your hand. Price was well worth the product. My Amazon find of the Month!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Bradford

customer_reviews.title: Great Knives
customer_reviews.text: I make some kind of stir-fry almost every day. To mix things up, I use a dozen or so different slicing styles. Having a sharp knife that will slice through thin-skinned veggies makes all the difference. These are sharp. And at the price, they are cheap to replace when I can't sharpen them anymore. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bufatutu

customer_reviews.title: The Best All-around Utility Paring Knife
customer_reviews.text: This paring knife was the America's Test Kitchen pick as the best paring knife of the many they put through a battery of tests for its sharpness, weight, maneuverability, grip and durability. It also happens to be most reasonably priced. I am SO happy I listened to their recommendation. It's a great all-around utility paring knife, way better than any I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Eric B52

customer_reviews.title: really really sharp
customer_reviews.text: First thing watch your fingers! knife is just the right size for me to use and I had no problems holding the handle firmly. Bought it to prep a couple of full tenderloins and it worked like a charm. It comes with a stupid plastic cover which you have to be very careful removing as the blade is extremely sharp. I bought a whetstone just in case I needed to sharpen the knife but its still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Midlandsjean

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This knife company was mentioned favorably on Cooks Country..I found it insubstantial. The handle is cheap looking and hard to grip. There is no flexibility. . It is priced too high. I am disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Carmie

customer_reviews.title: These knives are the BEST!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had a knife like this for about five years. It’s still as sharp as the day I bought it. I got another one because these are my favorite knives and I use them all the time. When I only had one of these knives, I was constantly looking in the dishwasher for it. Now that I have more than one, I’ve always got a knife clean and ready to use!
customer_reviews.author: denali dame

customer_reviews.title: extremely sharp
customer_reviews.text: When I first picked this knife up, I thought it felt like some cheap knife you would buy in the grocery store. Boy was I wrong. It is a fabulous piece of equipment! It is very sharp and flexible and you can use it without struggling to slice through anything. I highly recommend this knife and will be buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: E. Serafino

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I expected from Victorinox
customer_reviews.text: I generally like Victorinox products and this knife is no exception. I expected it to be super sharp and feel natural in my hand and that's exactly what I got. It is on the inexpensive side of their products so the handle quality is exactly what you would expect from an inexpensive knife that is still well-made. It's a quality knife for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Waller

customer_reviews.title: Use Everyday
customer_reviews.text: I use this knife so much that I bought two more - just so that one would always be on my magnetic knife rack and ready to use. I eat a lot of fruit, and whether it is avocados, mangos, oranges, or almost any other fruit, this knife is just the right size for almost every task (except for the times I need a chef knife.) I also got the 3" version, but the 4" version is the one I almost always use.
customer_reviews.author: TonyD

customer_reviews.title: Great paring knife
customer_reviews.text: This knife holds an edge well and has a fine blade that does the regular jobs well, plus more delicate tasks like peeling tomatoes or peaches. I have more expensive paring knives, but actually like the Victorinox ones better because they don't have to be sharpened as often and are more versatile.
customer_reviews.author: C. G. King

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly sharp and maneuverable knife at a fantastic price
customer_reviews.text: This is a better paring knife than my Henkel paring knife and costs only a fraction of what the Henkel costs. It goes through vegetables incredibly easily. I'm going to trim a roast this weekend. I will update this review if the knife does not perform well (which I do not expect).
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: These things are seriously the best. They NEVER go dull
customer_reviews.text: My family is Swiss and Victorinox has been our go-to knife brand forever. These things are seriously the best. They NEVER go dull. My mom has had hers for 25+ years and they are still the best knives in the house by a landslide. The serrated are my favorite for everything from slicing tomatoes to hacking through tough bread when I don't have a bread knife. Invest in these knives, invest in these knives, invest in these knives! You will not regret it!
customer_reviews.author: DCW

customer_reviews.title: the best
customer_reviews.text: very sharp, these are the best quality knives i’ve ever used at a modest price point. i bought some ikea knives that dulled quickly and have had a range of german and japanese knives as well. i was introduced to victorinox by a commercial deadliest catch crab fisherman who swore by victorinox gave me a grip of them and have never found anything better.
customer_reviews.author: nbp

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the kitchen maybe even for crime fighting.
customer_reviews.text: Have you ever heard the tip "let the weight of the knife do the cutting"? Yeah that never worked for me because every knife I owned was terrible. Even after sharpening, I'm still struggling. After this came in though, I'm like Wolverine. I'm just shredding through everything. Super sharp, great quality, definitely going to get a set of these knives!
customer_reviews.author: Peter Q.

customer_reviews.title: Handle Not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight and not sturdy. I always feel like the handle is going to break when I use it. It’s sharp, but I need to feel secure when using. I like Victorinox brand, but not this model.
customer_reviews.author: Linda A. Crumpton

customer_reviews.title: right size!
customer_reviews.text: I prefer knives that aren't too long for the job, and this knife is great. Nice and sharp, I've repeatedly run it through the dishwasher, (and while that probably means that it will wear out sooner than if I hand washed it,) it comes out beautifully and that's what I wanted. - a nice sized knife that can go in the dishwasher. I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Jan C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Pairing Knife!
customer_reviews.text: Great knife, extremely sharp! For my job I cut A LOT of limes and other fruit, and this knife cuts through like butter. It has an extremely fine edge, but it won’t hold that edge forever. So I’m sure you could sharpen it... but it’s so cheap, just buy another! That’s what I’ve been doing. Even when it’s dull, it’s sharper than most knives.
customer_reviews.author: chad keller

customer_reviews.title: Lighter than expected
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice, useful knife. But, it is lighter than I expected and has a concave groove in both sides of the grip so it took me a while to get used to it. I had bought it to replace a similar sized paring knife that had a more rounded grip. The shape of the grip is not obvious in the product photo. On arrival is was very sharp and I have not had to sharpen it in the several weeks I've had it. Time will tell...
customer_reviews.author: Hanover67

customer_reviews.title: Great little thing!
customer_reviews.text: One of the most versatile tools in my kitchen! I have purchased 2 of these in the past and both came really sharp and stay sharp for longer periods than other paring knives. I've been able to peel and cut apples and pears quickly. The length comes in handy for bigger fruits, but 4-inches is the max I'd wield for paring activities. I only wish Victorinox would provide a sharpener for their blades. I do have to hone the blades with other brands of sharpeners, but they become good as new afterwards. I've been using the Accusharp on this and my Victorinox 8-inch and they've been cutting smoothly!
customer_reviews.author: XMW

customer_reviews.title: Must Have for Kitchen
customer_reviews.text: These small Victorinox are a must have for the kitchen. Great quality, stays sharp long, easy to use. Perfect for cutting apples, small quick prep jobs that I dont want to use my Santoku or Chefs Knife for. Also not super expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Epic Stylee

customer_reviews.title: Great knife for the home kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I bought this knife along with two others by Victorinox as a Christmas present. It came sharp in good packaging and gets the job done. I'm not a picky person with my knives nor do I know much about them so I'm not sure how it compares to others. However, as someone who cooks a decent amount I am very pleased with this knife (and their other knives that I bought) and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn

customer_reviews.title: Victorinox is the best brand on the market
customer_reviews.text: Started purchasing Victorinox knives after seeing a review on America's Test Kitchen and I couldn't be happier. They are great and the prices can't be beat. No need to pay a ton of money for good kitchen knives - just buy Victorinox!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad knife, but it’s not a great knife. Holds its edge okay, but not great. But it’s cheap and I can treat it like junk. It’s not junk. But it’s not amazing. I throw it in the dishwasher bc I just don’t care. It’s cheap. And it’s cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Romeo

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp
customer_reviews.text: Someone else has mentioned that they were cut three times by the knife because it was so sharp. I chuckled at that until it happened to me too. You do have to be careful because it is sharper than most kitchen utensils. Keep it out of the hands of children and clumsy adults. The handle has been described as flimsy, but I disagree. It is simple but well shaped and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: BSquared18

customer_reviews.title: Sharp knife, but poor handle.
customer_reviews.text: Sharp knife, but the handle is made of cheap plastic. The handle is also too thin and narrow for you to get a good grip. It works, so I'll be keeping it, but they really should switch up that handle.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny W. Chan

customer_reviews.title: So good I bought more!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic knife and one that I constantly reach for when needed. It is the right weight, size, shaped and fits perfectly in all sizes of hands in our family. Retains its edge. I actually purchased more because that are that good!
customer_reviews.author: Forensic Doc

customer_reviews.title: Small, light, nimble, but still sharp and effective. A must have.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect knife for small tasks around the kitchen. I use this knife almost every day for more delicate task that would be too cumbersome for a chef's knife. A must have for any kitchen. For the price, buy 2 or 3 just in case you lose one.
customer_reviews.author: Eric U

customer_reviews.title: Excellent knives
customer_reviews.text: I honestly didn't have huge expectations the first time I bought one of these, but this was the third one I've bought. They come extremely sharp and seem to hold an edge really well. Much better than knives you normally get for the price.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kirby

customer_reviews.title: 4 inch paring knife
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect knife.......easy to hold, doesn't slip around in your hand, and very, very sharp. One of the best buys for your money on Amazon. I have several and I've given them as gifts to family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Swenson

customer_reviews.title: Quality brand
customer_reviews.text: You cant go wrong with a Victorinox knife. I bought a chef knife several years ago and love it. So when I needed a smaller paring knife I knew which brand I was going to go for. Excellent quality and razor sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Rothschild

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable in hand, versatile in use
customer_reviews.text: These are the best paring knives in the market. Victorinox also makes a great chef's knife that is my go-to knife. We use these paring knives to cut slices of apples, as steak knives, slicing small items like chives, and admittedly to slice open packages. Very resilient knife. The handle is very comfortable and non-slip. Sharpens up very well -- super sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Beauregard

customer_reviews.title: Very cheep
customer_reviews.text: It is dull quickly. Can not sharpen well. All my other types ; three ; Victorinox knifes are wonderful. This is a cheep edition. Don't cut ; useless. I can't sharpen well enough this one.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Paring Knives -- Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these paring knives several months ago, and they have done a great job on various types of produce. They're still sharp, and very reliable. I just bought two more a couple of days ago because I found myself using them so frequently, and I didn't want to keep hand washing them as often. I have used other paring knives from store retailers like IKEA, etc., and I highly recommend these! These are high quality knives that I can tell will last me for years and years.
customer_reviews.author: Bianca134

customer_reviews.title: Adequate knife not really sharp
customer_reviews.text: The knife feels light to the touch, although I read many reviews saying it was razor sharp. it was not. it was adequate but it could have been much sharper. I will probably spend 20 minutes honing the blade and getting it to a real Edge. but all in all for cutting a tomato it's quite adequate.
customer_reviews.author: Thawyzard

customer_reviews.title: Very handy knives
customer_reviews.text: This series of serrated knives are great for what they are. Inexpensive super sharp tools for specific purposes. Great addition to any knife rack. Buy all 3 or 4 sizes and discover which works best for which application . I like the pointed ones for light de-boning work etc. The road tip one is a bit heavier and stiffer....good for small slicing jobs like slicing a tomato etc.
customer_reviews.author: jayc

customer_reviews.title: Extremely light weight
customer_reviews.text: My first purchase of a Victorinox knife was somewhat disappointing. The small paring knife is indeed sharp, but there is no heft to the knife which I like when I do prep work in the kitchen. It is a good value for the price, but next time I will purchase a knife with more weight in the handle and the blade. Overall length is shorter than I need, but I was aware of the dimensions prior to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Alert
customer_reviews.text: It should be banned for cooking usage, when I first opened the package, the blade was wrapped in tight vinyl, so I was trying to clean the glue sticked on the blade and as soon I ran the paper towel to clean the blade, I got deep cut.
customer_reviews.author: hy92

customer_reviews.title: GREAT value for the price! Great workhorse!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for use at a bar to cut fruit garnishes every day and it works like a dream! It's lasted through daily use and dishwasher abuse for about 6 months now and I'm buying a second one because it's truly wonderful value for the dollar. Sure, the original one I bought isn't as sharp as when I bought it, but I also haven't tried to sharpen it with anything and at $8 to replace it why not?? Great little workhorse and perfectly suited for my use! I think I'll continue with this little knife for years!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, flexible blade.
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these knives. They are sharp and easy to keep that way. The flexibility of the blade make it very useful for paring, slicing , etc. Really reasonable price and the poly handle can go through the dishwasher if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Carol

customer_reviews.title: Loved it so much I bought another one.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this knife because it is light, easy to hold, stays sharp and can be cleaned in the dishwasher. This is my second one because I like to use separate knives for different foods.
customer_reviews.author: Yankee2

customer_reviews.title: Great, practical kitchen knives for general use
customer_reviews.text: The blade quality and sharpness is maybe only a tiny notch down from the really high-end knives, which probably doesn't matter to most of us everyday cooks, but these you can afford to buy several of to keep in a drawer and then run them through your normal cleaning routing, whether it's soaking in the sink or the dishwasher - I have never had any trouble with the high-quality blades pitting when cleaned with everything else, unlike some cheap supposedly stainless knives.
customer_reviews.author: J. P. Cass

customer_reviews.title: Great even for people with arthritis
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect kitchen paring knife short of products that are three or four times as expensive. The entire Victorinox line of knives is recommended by America's Test Kitchen (if that isn't enough reason to buy these). The grip on the handle is very easy to handle, even for my mom who has arthritis. This knife is also very lightweight to begin with and is easy on her hands. The blade is also excellent as always from the brand.
customer_reviews.author: Insane Totoro

customer_reviews.title: Great paring knife
customer_reviews.text: Cost effective and very useful. Price point spot on! Does what the more expensive competitors can do and, if necessary, easily replaced without breaking your budget.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Toth

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Knife, Small Handle
customer_reviews.text: The knife came sharp as can be ready to cut with. No issues cutting what I needed it to cut in the kitchen. The handle though seems a bit small and the way it is designed makes it hard to tell what way to grab the knife. Its something I will get use to as I use the knife more and more but if you have larger hands like I do the knife may feel a little awkward to work with.
customer_reviews.author: T. Schmitt

customer_reviews.title: Great size and sharpness
customer_reviews.text: This is just the right size and sharpness for cutting meat and other smaller items in preparation for cooking. It also cuts up salad lettuce and onions and tomatoes.
customer_reviews.author: David C Oakes

customer_reviews.title: WHAT A KNIFE!
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS A WELL BALANCED LIGHTWEIGHT KNIFE WITH AN EXTREMELY SHARP BLADE. THE HANDLE LOOKS A LITTLE LONG BUT FITS WELL IN MY REGULAR SIZED HAND. DON"T LET THE PRICE FOOL YOU, THIS IS A FINE PARING KNIFE.
customer_reviews.author: linda

customer_reviews.title: great utility knife
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp, great utility knife. Comfortable in hand. Handle seems like a sturdy strong plastic. Using it for six months every day for cutting things like fruits, vegetables, trimming fats from meats, still reliable and sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Anne, Los Angeles CA

customer_reviews.title: Sharpness matters
customer_reviews.text: Loved Victorinox knives. I knew about it’s ability to maintain sharpness over time from my Swiss Army knife. They’re incredible. A bit small if you have big hands. Perfect for me. Don’t have to sharpen as often like the cheap Farberware. Don’t waste money of 3.25 in though. Way too small.
customer_reviews.author: NEWBY

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother with anything cheaper than Victorinox!
customer_reviews.text: This knife is quite lightweight and very sharp. The Fibrox handle feels good to my hand -- one of very few instances where I prefer a synthetic material over wood. The blade is very thin, allowing it to slice easily through thick fruit skins (oranges and the like), and narrow enough to allow carving (as with apples). It's only the second Victorinox I've bought but it's already solidifying my loyalty to the brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Overholt

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sharp paring knife. It is a little light to the touch and doesn't have a great feel, but it does the job at a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: My Opinion

customer_reviews.title: BEST STESK KNIVES I'VE HAD!
customer_reviews.text: I like these knives so much that I now have 16 of them. Although they aren't as elegant as my other steak knives, these feel great in my hand and cut beautifully, so I really don't care. We have 2 homes so I'm sure I'll be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: NancyJ

customer_reviews.title: Thanks, Wirecutter!
customer_reviews.text: We have a big set of Cutco knives and a bunch of miscellaneous ones, but for cutting fruits and smaller veggies, I always turn to this knife. Super sharp, light, easy to maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: B. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Handle with care!  Not a crummy knife!
customer_reviews.text: Second Victorinox kitchen knife I've owned, and I'm slowly replacing all the others! Word of warning - these are SHARP and STAY SHARP and are EASY TO MAKE SHARP AGAIN! Took the tip of my thumb off slicing a grapefruit last month! The only possible improvement Victorinox could make would be to make nicer looking handles... my 4-inch paring knife has gone through the dishwasher a couple times after being mistaken for a lower quality knife.
customer_reviews.author: Sic Semper Tyrannis

customer_reviews.title: Nice, light weight knife.
customer_reviews.text: I like it. It's very light weight, but does a good job. The tip is very sharp, so it slices into whatever you are cutting (including your finger if you're not careful). I use it regularly and choose it over my older paring knife which isn't bad. It's been through the dishwasher, but I usually wash/dry it by hand...that's my own preference in hopes that it lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy

customer_reviews.title: Extremely functional
customer_reviews.text: This is the first serrated paring knife I've come across, and it is SUPERIOR to all similar sized knives I've used EVER. But be careful; it is VERY, VERY sharp, —which is exactly what we want in a knife. Now we shall see how it weathers utilization over time.
customer_reviews.author: J.T.M.

customer_reviews.title: Good, but like chef's knife a little better
customer_reviews.text: Good, but can't tell if it was necessary for me. I bought two Victorinox knives as a starter kit. I like the 6 inch Fibrox Pro Chef's knife a little better because I use it more often. I am usually cutting vegetables and fruits in the kitchen. Actually, always because I'm vegan. So I don't know how this knife or the chef's knife do with cheeses/meats.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice sharp knife for a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one. I love the size and comfortable fit in my hand. The biggest plus is that it is SHARP! I use one color knife for meat and the other for everything else. They both seem to be holding their edges well so far, better than I expected in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: My favorite knife company
customer_reviews.text: Victorinox always delivers on quality knives, for a budget price. The handle is plastic, but sturdy, and the blade is resilient and ever-sharp. I have two Victorinox knives- this and the 8" slicer- and no regrets after 5+ years.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and cheap, what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I'm no chef, but this knife is becoming my favorite. It's very sharp and easy to handle. I also have the chef's knife from the same company and have been very pleased with their price/quality. I've had this one for a few months and the chef's knife for a couple years. They hold up very well. The handle has a bit of a cheap look, but I like the way it feels and you can't ask for more at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Magnanti

customer_reviews.title: I love my new pairing knife
customer_reviews.text: I truly love my new pairing knife !! It feels good in my hand and it slices like a breeze. I would recommend it to anyone !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Thelma I. Kobalka

customer_reviews.title: Victorinox Paring Knife
customer_reviews.text: This paring knife is very sharp and it holds its edge very well in normal kitchen use. This is a plus but also a minus. I have cut my fingers several times because I am not used to such a sharp knife. I have to be very careful when washing it by hand. Another plus is that it is slightly longer than my previous paring knife so it handles large fruits such as grapefruit better.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Sky

customer_reviews.title: Paring Knife
customer_reviews.text: This knife was the number 1 paring knife out of about 10 on Cooks Country TV show, and it lives up to it's award. Very sharp, good length, great handle.
customer_reviews.author: Chet

customer_reviews.title: Very useful knife at a very good price
customer_reviews.text: This knite is very sharp and cuts very well. The size is ideal for use in cutting up or peeling fruits and vegetables. It is a bit longer than the other paring knives that I have in my kitchen, so I use it frequently for a number of tasks. A very useful knife at a very good price.
customer_reviews.author: FuzzAMZ

customer_reviews.title: Favorite knives!
customer_reviews.text: These have been our go to knives for over twenty years. We received a pair as a wedding gift and have continued to buy a few new ones every year. Can't tell the new ones from the old ones. The original knives are still in our drawer cutting away. We prefer the serrated which have held their sharpness beautifully. One of my favorite amazon purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Byron J Pollan

customer_reviews.title: The grip is so ergonomically comfortable. The blade is super sharp and the perfect ...
customer_reviews.text: The grip is so ergonomically comfortable. The blade is super sharp and the perfect size for small jobs. I have already begun replacing my old straight handled knives with the Victorinox ergo grip knives: bread, and larger chefs knives. Boning, filet and clever are next.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel V.

customer_reviews.title: Superb Paring Knife
customer_reviews.text: This will be my go to paring knife. Easy to hold, very sharp, and does the job. Do a lot of chopping veggies and cutting things up. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Donna M

customer_reviews.title: Strongly recommended
customer_reviews.text: This knife is comfortable to hold and sharp to work with. The seller's service was excellent, and I shall be using it again.
customer_reviews.author: Khalid Ikram

customer_reviews.title: Best inexpensive paring knife you can buy.
customer_reviews.text: I used to use only Wuistoff or Henkel knives but they have been priced out of my budget. I've tried several different brands and have adopted Victorinox as I replace my worn out knives. My latest addition is this serrated edge paring knife.
customer_reviews.author: Page Scandrol

customer_reviews.title: This knife is sharp!
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered another because it is such a pleasure to use this knife: peeling fruit, cutting anything that requires close work.
customer_reviews.author: deepwater

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! This knife is sharp, it cuts through mostly everything you put under it including your fingers. Be super careful with this knife, it 100% does what it promises but take extra safety when handling. I will be ordering another, its makes cutting and chopping so easy and effortless. I can't speak for dishwasher safety, I hand wash the knife to keep it's quality.
customer_reviews.author: Just My Two Cents

customer_reviews.title: How sharp they are.  Beware new users.
customer_reviews.text: I have used these knives for many years. My son introduced them me after he worked on a crab boat in Alaska. The crew wore them on a belt over their rain gear, in case they got caught up in the lines. Sharpest knife ever.
customer_reviews.author: Neva M. Slocum

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp and nice paring knife
customer_reviews.text: This is very useful everyday knife. I am using these knives over 5 years and I haven't faced any problem. It is not flexible blade and very sharp. Do not try to use as a lever for opening to jar lids. I broke one of them like that which I shouldn't have done this.
customer_reviews.author: Baha

customer_reviews.title: Simple and easy to use pairing knife
customer_reviews.text: Simple and easy to use pairing knife. The classic never gets old. Victorinox still makes high quality products.
customer_reviews.author: Sanjar

customer_reviews.title: Great knife, better price.
customer_reviews.text: These knives are fantastically sharp and very well priced. I've just purchased my 3rd in 5 years after having spent $45 on a much more expensive brand of paring knife. These are perfectly priced to use for 1-1.5 years and when they dull, simply replace them. (Goes for every Victorinox knife I've had). And over the 12-18 months I use my knives a lot - cutting fruits, assisting in butchering, small knife work around the kitchen. This is amazing bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie

customer_reviews.title: Economical & Efficient
customer_reviews.text: You cannot beat this little knife. We had one at home & also ordered one for our RV. The price is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Ricki

customer_reviews.title: Great Everyday Knife
customer_reviews.text: The very sharp, serrated edge makes cutting so easy. And you know, you get hurt with a dull knife, not a sharp one! Plan on ordering two more (very reasonable priced) so my wife and I don’t have to fight over the one we recently received. She plans to order a few more for our (adult) kids Christmas stocking stuffers.
customer_reviews.author: JFetterolf

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value and Super Sharp Knife
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent knives for the money. Stays sharp a long time, but as it starts to dull, just a few swipes on the steel brings it right back to super sharp. The red handle is nice so it doesn't get accidently tossed when the kitchen is in full blown cooking mayhem. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew C

customer_reviews.title: Great little knife
customer_reviews.text: My adult children have guilted me into purchasing new knives, telling me that mine are cheap and awful to use. After reading the reviews, I decided to get this one to replace my paring knife. This is a great little knife. It is light-weight but very sharp and works well. I love it! I guess the kids are right - good knives are worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: C. Branson

customer_reviews.title: Decent mid-priced knives
customer_reviews.text: The Victronix knives are great. I was a bit of a fool and spent a lot of money on a certain competitor's knives (hint: Rhymes with rut-ro). The Victronix knives have a great, no-slip handle, cut gracefully, and can be sharpened by conventional sharpeners. The price is great and the knife works well. They go in the dishwasher and no rust spots are visible (though it's only been a few months). I'll look to build my collection going forward.
customer_reviews.author: Micky

customer_reviews.title: Good price - great knife
customer_reviews.text: I saw this recommended on America's Test Kitchen and was surprised and the price. When it came in - I love it. Lightweight but secure as a pairing knife, and really sharp. I hope it holds the sharpness - loving it for now.
customer_reviews.author: VSTrip

customer_reviews.title: Off-label use!
customer_reviews.text: I use these knives for weeding in tight spots and they are great - easy to sharpen so they slice weeds off in no time.
customer_reviews.author: M. Harrington

customer_reviews.title: Great knife
customer_reviews.text: Great for slicing my kiwis for breakfast. GF prefers a shorter bladed paring knife, but I like the size.
customer_reviews.author: P. Burrola

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: How did I live without this knife. Summertime is tomato time . Great little knife with a great price .
customer_reviews.author: cwc

customer_reviews.title: Great sharp knife
customer_reviews.text: Love this knife. Cant believe its not more expensive. I have bought 3 total and Will buy more
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sharp blade, very nice knife for price
customer_reviews.text: Nice sharp blade and a good choice for a functional paring knife. The handle is a sturdy plastic but comfortable to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Heavoor

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Knife !!
customer_reviews.text: Good Quality knife. I have used this brand knife before and they are very durable and keep the edge for a long time. Easy to clean and low maintenance product. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: AB

product_meta.title: Victorinox 6.7733, Black 4 Inch Swiss Classic Paring Knife with Serrated Edge, Round tip , 4"
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Style:SerratedThe Swiss Classic Paring Knife will stand out from the rest of the knives in your drawer thanks to its ultra-sharp wavy edge and pointed tip. Together, they enable you to go right through thick peels. Removing seeds and cores has never been easier. It's just what you need to turn a pile of vegetables into a beautiful, nutritious meal.
feature_bullets: Multipurpose serrated paring knife designed for everything from garnishing, mincing, or peeling, to slicing or dicing
The ergonomically designed, contoured Swiss Classic handle is inspired by our patented Fibrox Pro line and provides a sure grip and easy handling, even when wet
Featuring a short blade for enhanced accuracy and precision, this paring knife is optimally built for jobs where control is essential
Serrated edge allows you to easily slice through delicate, soft-skinned fruits and vegetables, such as tomatoes or kiwis, without squashing tender interiors
Expertly crafted in Switzerland since 1884; designed for professionals who use knives all day, every day; lifetime warranty against defects in material and workmanship

specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
